intro: Lasiandra sericans, commonly known as the slender lasiandra, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slight pubescence. Lasiandra sericans is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
